com.beepell.broker
Class MessageBinding

java.lang.Object
  com.beepell.broker.MessageBinding

public class MessageBinding
extends Object

Utility class to bind SOAP messages with message variables.

Tim Hallwyl

Method Detail

bind

public static SOAPMessage bind(MessageVariable variable,
                               String style,
                               QName operation,
                               String direction)
                        throws SOAPException,
                               DOMException,
                               UninitializedVariable
Creates a SOAP message from a message variable.

Note: encoded style is not WS-I compliant, so literal binding is assumed.

Parameters:
variable - variable to bind as message, may be null if the message has no parts.
style - must be either document or rpc.
operation - operation name
direction - Either "request" or "response"
Returns:
A SOAP (request or reply) message.
Throws:
SOAPException - if the message cannot be bound, for example if the WSDL is not WS-I compliant.
DOMException - should not happen.
UninitializedVariable - if the message variable is not initialized

bind

public static void bind(SOAPMessage message,
                        MessageVariable variable,
                        String style,
                        QName operation,
                        String direction)
                 throws SOAPException
Binds a SOAP message to a message variable. If either message or variable is null, nothing is done. The binding is a copy operation, thus changing the variable afterwards will not affect the SOAP message.

Parameters:
message - message to copy values from
variable - message variable to copy values to.
style - either "rpc" or "document"
operation - operation name
direction - Either "request" or "response"
Throws:
SOAPException

bind

public static void bind(SOAPFault fault,
                        MessageVariable variable)
                 throws MessagingFault
Bind an incoming SOAP fault to a message variable.

A fault message, contained in the details of a SOAPFault, is a document/literal bound message â€“ and as such is may have at most one part, and this part must be referring an element declaration. R2204, R2205, R2206.

Parameters:
fault - the incoming SOAP fault
variable - the message variable
Throws:
MessagingFault
